org.conqat.lib.commons.resources

Class Resource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.conqat.lib.commons.resources.Resource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Resource>

    public class Resource
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Resource>
    Represents a java resource which is identified by a contextClass and a path. The resource will be loaded using the same class loader that was used to load the contextClass. The path consists of the class' package name plus the path. A resource object is always guaranteed to exist meaning that instantiation of a non-existent resource will fail.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static Resource of(java.lang.Class<?> contextClass,
                          java.lang.String path)
        Creates an instance of a resource. If the resource does not exist and AssertionError is thrown. Check with exists(Class, String) before creating an instance in case it might be missing.

      • asOptional

        public static java.util.Optional<Resource> asOptional(java.lang.Class<?> contextClass,
                                                      java.lang.String path)
        Creates an instance of a resource. Returns empty if the resource does not exist.

        Creates an instance of a resource. If the resource does not exist an AssertionError is thrown. Check with exists(Class, String) before creating an instance in case it might be missing.

      • hasExtension

        public boolean hasExtension(java.lang.String... extensions)
        Returns true is the resource's extension matches one of the given extensions. In contrast to getExtension() this method supports also extensions that contain dots.

      • getContextClass

        public java.lang.Class<?> getContextClass()
        Returns the resource's context class.

      • getPath

        public java.lang.String getPath()
        Returns the resource's path relative to the contextClass including the resource's name.

      • getUrl

        public java.net.URL getUrl()
        Returns the resource's url.

      • getParentPath

        public java.lang.String getParentPath()
        Returns the resource's parent path. This is the getPath() without the resource's name.

      • getAbsolutePath

        public java.lang.String getAbsolutePath()
        Returns the resource's absolute path including the contextClass' package name.

      • getPathSegmentAt

        public java.lang.String getPathSegmentAt(int index)
        Returns only a single path segment of the resource's path. If the index is negative the path segments are counted from the end of the path. E.g. for "base/sub/name.txt" 0=base, -1=name.txt, -2=1=sub.

      • getAsStream

        public java.io.InputStream getAsStream()
        Get resource as stream.

      • getAsByteArray

        public byte[] getAsByteArray()
        Returns the resource as a raw byte array.

      • getContentAsRawString

        public java.lang.String getContentAsRawString()
        Get resource as string (assuming UTF-8 encoding) without normalized line separators.

      • getContent

        public java.lang.String getContent()
        Get resource as string (assuming UTF-8 encoding) with normalized line separators.

      • getLines

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLines()
        Returns the content of the resource split into lines.

      • getAsTmpFile

        public java.io.File getAsTmpFile()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a temporary copy of the resource in the systems default temp file location. The file will be marked for deletion when the JVM shuts down.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • copyTo

        public java.io.File copyTo(java.io.File file)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Copies the resource to the given file. Parent directories are created if they do not exist yet. If the file itself already exists it wil be overridden.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • unzipTo

        public void unzipTo(java.io.File tempDir)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Unzips the resource into into the given folder under a folder with the same name as the resource's base name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Overrides:

      • lastModified

        public long lastModified()
        Returns the timestamp in milliseconds of the last modification in case the underlying resource url is a file. Returns -1 of the underlying resource is an entry in a jar file. Calling this method only makes sense after calling ResourceUtils.getFileBackedResource(Resource).
